thread.title: Carthage Central Athletes Face 'Consequences' After Party
thread.title_full: Carthage Central Athletes Face 'Consequences' After Party

title: Carthage Central Athletes Face 'Consequences' After Party
text:
Carthage Central Athletes Face 'Consequences' After Party   7, 2015 at 2:24 PM   7, 2015 at 11:07 PM EDT 
18 student-athletes from Carthage Central face "consequences" after attending a party last weekend at which alcohol was present, according to superintendent Peter Turner. 
Turner said state police have been informed. He told 7 News he will not name the students or teams affected. 
Turner did say multiple fall sports teams were affected. ( Update Wednesday night: 7 News sports director Mel Busler was told "a number" of varsity football players were amomg the 18. ) 
All 18 students were suspended for 10 percent of their overall sport season, he said. 
Turner said each student will miss about 2 sporting events under the suspension. 
It's possible some students attended the party but didn't drink, according to a statement from Turner. 
"The consumption of alcohol is for police to determine. The district believes these students made a poor choice and consequences are appropriate. Any student present at this party could have made the decision to leave once alcohol was introduced," Turner noted in his statement. 
He said "consequences" were assigned based on the district's athletic code. 
Turner said the district launched an investigation after the athletic director was "made aware" of the party. 
The announcement from Turner comes at an unusual moment for athletics in the north country - five players from the Indian River football team were suspended for unspecified violations of team rules, and South Lewis was forced to scrap the remainder of its football season because of player injuries.
